alert.note: Alert for Montgomery; Treutlen; Wheeler (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 02 at 10:07PM EDT until April 05 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Ocmulgee River at Abbeville affecting Wilcox, Telfair and Dodge Counties. Ocmulgee River at US 341 at Hawkinsville affecting Pulaski and Bleckley Counties. Oconee River near Mount Vernon affecting Wheeler, Montgomery and Treutlen Counties. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Georgia... Oconee River at Dublin affecting Laurens, Johnson, Wilkinson and Washington Counties. For the Ocmulgee River Basin...including Jackson, Griffin, Juliette, Juliette, Dames Ferry, Macon, Macon, Hawkinsville, Byron, Clinchfield, Hawkinsville, Abbeville, McRae, Scotland, Lumber City... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Oconee River Basin...including Penfield, Milledgeville, Oconee, Oconee, McIntyre, Irwinton, Oconee, Dublin, Mount Vernon... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Oconee River near Mount Vernon. * WHEN...Until Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 19 feet, Minor flooding expands further into the woodlands and pastures upstream and downstream from the gage on U.S. Highway 280. The boat ramp parking lot is flooded out on the Wheeler County side of the river. More homes on Dead River Road in the south part of Montgomery County become surrounded with water. Some flooding inside the structures is possible. Some portions of Dead River Road are covered by at least a foot of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM EDT Sunday the stage was 18.8 feet and slowly falling. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Wednesday afternoon and continue falling to 11.4 feet Friday evening. - Flood stage is 16 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
